entries.title: Alien::Base Beta Release!
entries.text: The Alien::* modules make it easy to install external (non-CPAN) dependencies in a CPAN module. That usually makes the life of the user easier, but creating Alien modules was hard. The Alien::BAse module should make it much easier for the developer. Go ahead, test it.

entries.title: Why LedgerSMB uses Moose. An intro for PostgreSQL folks
entries.text: The article starts off by describing the major sources of bugs in any application, and then explains how using Moose can eliminate some of them. The comparision to SQL data safety is an interesting way to show Moose. (BTW this article is a few months old, I just misplaced it back then.)

entries.title: My hiring principles
entries.text: Do you want to get hired by Andrew Shitov? First make sure you have a picture with Larry Wall. Then read the article for further clues.

entries.title: Please Don't Write Snowflake Code
entries.text: So what do you say, should Perl projects have a standard style? Should they pick one from several standard styles? Is it ok to use your personal coding style in an Open source project? What about within a company?
